Ratings.comment: Dr. Lisa is one of the best professors I've ever had. 2300 is a difficult class, but if you read the textbook, attend lectures, and pay attention, you'll be just fine. Exams are rough, but final grades are curved accordingly (for example, in AU24, a 75% rounded to an A). And he's a Cavs fan, so thats a win. #LetEmKnow
His office hour is always helpful. The homework and exams have a suitable difficult-level. The final grades will be highly curved.

He's passionate about pushing kids further than they've been pushed before. It would've been better executed if he was less condescending and more encouraging. The exams being so obscenely difficult resulted in a lot of students feeling not smart enough for the class (even though they were above the average). My C rounded to an A-, so huge curve.
The organization of the lecture is not very good, the homework is difficult, and the exams are also difficult, but the curve is very generous!
Lousy teaching, difficult exam, but a generous curve.

Mr. Lisa is a very solid professor. He knows very deeply in Physics. However, the difficulty of the Physics 2300 course is high, but he will provide the curve based on the difficulty of his exams. Therefore, you do not need to worry about your grade if you learn hard on Physics 2300. Highly recommend Mr. Lisa!

Prof. Lisa is charming when he gives lectures. In some way, he actually made me more passionate about physics. Yet, I hate the flipped mode so much. It doesn't make any sense to watch the videos before the lectures and go to the lectures only for group discussions. I prefer the traditional lectures. Also, the midterms and quizzes are challenging.

Very solid professor. He makes such a difficult course easy-understanding. Although the homework, quizzes, exams are very challenging, you could still get a good grade if you put effort in because of the curve.

PHY2300 was the hardest class I've ever taken. Prof. Lisa didn't assign too much homework, but it took a long time to complete. He was also very generous with partial credit on the exams, and the final grade got curved up quite a bit. Try to read the book and watch the lectures before going to class, practice problems at home, and you'll do fine.

It's the best prof and I love to take his class cuz he got a vivid class where all have chance to follow up and ask question. He is very patient and enthusiastic over physics, which I think the most important factor

Lisa cares greatly for his students. That being said, Physics 2300 was the hardest class I've ever taken. I would frequently spend 8-10 hours on a single homework assignment, and recieve grades of 50% on tests.

Mikey knows how to teach an honors-level introductory class. He chose to teach an introductory course instead of being forced. Expect him to have some fun lectures and some boring ones. Don't understate his exams and quizzes. Be careful because you are expected to put in the work and show that you can for a grade. Please call him Mikey

Dr. Lisa is an excellent honors professor who asks very thought provoking and difficult questions that challenge you more than you would expect from a typical physics class. He is always very clear, has a definite plan before each class, and is very open to any questions from students and answers them well.

Dr. Lisa is a solid professor. He is very helpful: he would answer basically any question anyone had in class. He is also very accessible and approachable during office hours. As another commenter has said, the class was curved substantially, but you will have to work hard regardless. It is a tough class, but Dr. Lisa makes it more bearable.

The class is hard, but he's a very effective teacher and the info is there if you put the work in. Genuinely wants students to understand physics principles. The grading seemed tough at first but easy to adjust to the system. Hinted at a very large curve to avoid failing a bunch of kids (some of whom deserved it). Bit of a strange dude but funny.

Dr. Lisa is a really great lecturer. He is incredibly smart and funny at times and he is really good at keeping the class engaged during lecture. His exams and quizzes though are super hard so be sure to really understand the concepts and how to do problems.

Professor Lisa is an incredible smart man, so smart, that I think he often forgets practical capabilities of students at my level (freshman physics major). His lectures are pretty good, and his homework and quizzes are reasonable, but when it comes to midterms and the final I had a lot to complain about; they are unnecessarily difficult/calc heavy.

Lisa gave great lectures and is a very intelligent man, but his tests were impossible. Going to lecture is important, but I found that reading the book and doing practice problems helped the most. He is known to use problems from the book on quizzes. He can be a little conceited at times and doesn't care that his tests are extremely difficult.

Super great lecturer, very passionate about what he is teaching and sharing his knowledge. Office hours were also helpful, but his tests and quizes are notoriously difficult with questions you haven't seen before. Good luck if you're in 1251...

Dr. Lisa is probably the best Physics prof. at OSU. This does not mean that he is going to make the class easy. He has a true passion for physics and what he teaches. The main thing is that Physics 1251 is an extremely hard subject and you have to put a lot of time and effort into the course. Just having Prof Lisa doesn't guarantee a good grade!!!
PLEASE DO NOT DROP THE MAJOR!!! CLASS IS NOT LIKE REST OF THE DEGREE!!!

Dr. Lisa is one of the best professors I've ever had. 2300 is a difficult class, but if you read the textbook, attend lectures, and pay attention, you'll be just fine. Exams are rough, but final grades are curved accordingly (for example, in AU24, a 75% rounded to an A). And he's a Cavs fan, so thats a win. #LetEmKnow
His office hour is always helpful. The homework and exams have a suitable difficult-level. The final grades will be highly curved.

He's passionate about pushing kids further than they've been pushed before. It would've been better executed if he was less condescending and more encouraging. The exams being so obscenely difficult resulted in a lot of students feeling not smart enough for the class (even though they were above the average). My C rounded to an A-, so huge curve.
The organization of the lecture is not very good, the homework is difficult, and the exams are also difficult, but the curve is very generous!
Lousy teaching, difficult exam, but a generous curve.

Mr. Lisa is a very solid professor. He knows very deeply in Physics. However, the difficulty of the Physics 2300 course is high, but he will provide the curve based on the difficulty of his exams. Therefore, you do not need to worry about your grade if you learn hard on Physics 2300. Highly recommend Mr. Lisa!

Prof. Lisa is charming when he gives lectures. In some way, he actually made me more passionate about physics. Yet, I hate the flipped mode so much. It doesn't make any sense to watch the videos before the lectures and go to the lectures only for group discussions. I prefer the traditional lectures. Also, the midterms and quizzes are challenging.

Very solid professor. He makes such a difficult course easy-understanding. Although the homework, quizzes, exams are very challenging, you could still get a good grade if you put effort in because of the curve.

He was also very generous with partial credit on the exams, and the final grade got curved up quite a bit. Try to read the book and watch the lectures before going to class, practice problems at home, and you'll do fine.

It's the best prof and I love to take his class cuz he got a vivid class where all have chance to follow up and ask question. He is very patient and enthusiastic over physics, which I think the most important factor

Lisa cares greatly for his students. That being said, Physics 2300 was the hardest class I've ever taken. I would frequently spend 8-10 hours on a single homework assignment, and recieve grades of 50% on tests.

Don't understate his exams and quizzes. Be careful because you are expected to put in the work and show that you can for a grade. Please call him Mikey

He is always very clear, has a definite plan before each class, and is very open to any questions from students and answers them well.

Dr. Lisa is a solid professor. He is very helpful: he would answer basically any question anyone had in class. He is also very accessible and approachable during office hours. As another commenter has said, the class was curved substantially, but you will have to work hard regardless. It is a tough class, but Dr. Lisa makes it more bearable.

The class is hard, but he's a very effective teacher and the info is there if you put the work in. Genuinely wants students to understand physics principles. The grading seemed tough at first but easy to adjust to the system. Hinted at a very large curve to avoid failing a bunch of kids (some of whom deserved it). Bit of a strange dude but funny.

Dr. Lisa is a really great lecturer. He is incredibly smart and funny at times and he is really good at keeping the class engaged during lecture. His exams and quizzes though are super hard so be sure to really understand the concepts and how to do problems.

Professor Lisa is an incredible smart man, so smart, that I think he often forgets practical capabilities of students at my level (freshman physics major). His lectures are pretty good, and his homework and quizzes are reasonable, but when it comes to midterms and the final I had a lot to complain about; they are unnecessarily difficult/calc heavy.

Lisa gave great lectures and is a very intelligent man, but his tests were impossible. Going to lecture is important, but I found that reading the book and doing practice problems helped the most. He is known to use problems from the book on quizzes. He can be a little conceited at times and doesn't care that his tests are extremely difficult.

Super great lecturer, very passionate about what he is teaching and sharing his knowledge. Office hours were also helpful, but his tests and quizes are notoriously difficult with questions you haven't seen before. Good luck if you're in 1251...

Dr. Lisa is probably the best Physics prof. at OSU. This does not mean that he is going to make the class easy. He has a true passion for physics and what he teaches. The main thing is that Physics 1251 is an extremely hard subject and you have to put a lot of time and effort into the course. Just having Prof Lisa doesn't guarantee a good grade!!!

Professor Lisa is a good instructor. However, I think the way he teaches us is wrong somehow. The quizzes and midterms are much harder than those from other professors. My roommate can get an A but I only got a C+. There is no lecture notes posted on Carmen, so you have to attend the lectures. C+ affects the GPA that enter my major.I have to retake

So some people have rated Dr. Lisa as average/bad  because the class is hard and you actually have to go to class-It's physics. Expect it to be hard. Dr. Lisa is the BEST professor this school has to offer. He is extremely engaging, brilliant, and funny. He is very approachable and explains things VERY well. If you are taking physics, he is a MUST

Michael is a great professor; however extremely difficult, possibly because it is difficult material in the first place. I recommend taking this professor, lectures are interesting and fun because he has such a passion for physics.

You have to go to lecture to pass this class with Lisa. Its your only source of information of what will be on the test because he deviates from the textbook occasionally. The clicker questions in class and the homework on webassign are good indicators of what tests will be like. Lisa is good at explaining things, not great at writing them down.

Amazing prof, one of the best ive had at OSU. His examples make sense & are so helpful u find urself later referring to your notes because theyre actually of use. If you ask a question in class, no matter how stupid, he'll answer it very well & incorporate it into the lecture, he even follows up w/ u later. Very fair w/ midterms. And hes hilarious.
Dr. Lisa can inspire students even about physics E&M, which is a major accomplishment.

He's a great lecturer, I currently have him for Physics EM (1251). The tests are pretty hard, but I'm assuming he will curve them somewhat. One complaint is no equation sheets are given for quizzes which is really tough, but they are provided for exams.

Lisa is the best professor that I ever meet in OSU. He's patient with repeating the examples and explaining them clearly when someone doesnt understand. His quizs are fair, not hard and not easy. The second one is a bit challenging coz magnetic field is so tricky.  He really helps a lot in lecture. And he's pretty hilarious.

Physics of Sports was a great class.  I only took it because I needed a GEC. I didn't like physics in high school, so I hoped it wasn't really physics.  But it was, and it wasn't too bad. It was cool to use forces and energy and math to understand sports. The book was cool. The tests and homeworks were pretty hard but he curves a lot at the end.

Lectures were long and boring for what you would think is going to be an interesting course about the physics of sports. Book used for class is one of the worst things ever written. Quizzes and homework problems are very confusing and difficult. This guy is the king of curveballs.

Professor Lisa was one of the best lecturers I've had at OSU. His lectures are extremely helpful and, while he does ask some tricky concept questions on exams, he always makes sure to explain the concept before the test in lecture, SO GO TO CLASS!
He is a great professor who makes the class interesting even though physics is the worst subject known to man kind. His exams are difficult but he curves them after

Physics of Sports was great with Prof. Lisa.  Made his own textbook out of the slides he used in class.  Weekly homework was very similar to questions in class. He was very clear about specific principles and concepts he guaranteed to be on quizzes+midterm. Offered a group project instead of taking a final,was very helpful w/ developing the project

Spoke clearly. Really helpful demos. Said funny things. Exam 2 was difficult. I would recommend him to another student! Quiz easiness was hit or miss. TA was really good and cared about students a lot. Lab was pointless. Take Prof. Lisa if possible!!

Professor Lisa is one of the best lecturers I've had in my time at OSU. He is very clear in presenting the material and though his class was difficult, he made it thoroughly enjoyable. His sense of humor during lectures didn't hurt my interest level either.
this professor is cold hearted. his exams are so hard for no reason. the average is so low that he has curve the class. take someone else if you can.
Great professor! He speaks loudly and is able to make complicated material easy to understand. Test and quiz averages were fairly low, but he curves up to an 80% so that's awesome
Great professor.  Makes quantum physics and relativity interesting.
Explains things very clearly.  Checks to make sure students understand.  Loud voice.  Tests are hard, but are curved at the end.  Good prof!

I hated this class - he had two T.A.'s and taught one of the sections himself. His sections averaged much better on the exams than those of the T.A.'s because there were questions he went over himself but NOT in lecture.

great teacher. Exams and quizzes very difficult. Mid-term median was 38 out of 100. Curve was 39 points. He explains the basics very well, but tests on complicated problems. It really makes you think, which is what makes him a great teacher, but also gives you an ulcer. Even though the tests are that difficult, I'd take a class from him again.

i did not like his teaching style. dr.lisa was the only prof that did NOT allow us to use notes and homework on the weekly quizzes which was bs. every other prof allowed it. and the midterm average was a 38/100 because the thing was IMPOSSIBLE. no wonder he had to curve it 40%.

100% English-speaking professor.  He is a very energetic prof with a projecting voice which makes it easy to pay attention. He will gladly answer any question you have. Exams are fair and represent the material well. Webassign sometimes had material on it that was not yet covered.  Overall a very good professor. Recommended!

He is challenging but fair. He gears his quizzes and midterms toward comprehension of the concepts in the class, not just knowing how to use equations. He is an energetic lecturer and manages to keep class bearable. He addresses all questions thoroughlyr Sometimes interjects political opinions, but only as a joke or side note.
A few of his test questions were completely unlike those presented in class/homework.  Quizes & tests were difficult.  Professor generally explained material well and in an interesting manner.
He is a very good professor. Tests were fair and his recitations are worth going to.

great teacher.  very enthusiastic and wants to help.  go to lectures and study, though, because tests and quizzes are hard.  I had him before, though, and with the curve the grades are fair at the end.
Made me interested in Physics, I hated it before.  Great notes, and good all around
He is very willing to help, I thought he really was interested in teaching

Dr. Lisa is a very cool individual-someone you may like to go have a beer with. But he will screw you in his class. He tells you a lot of stuff you don't even need to know-and tests you on stuff that you did not even talk about in lecture. The class was a nightmare!
Good professor, the first midterm was cake, the second was average, the final was the hardest test I've ever taken, the class is curved though so it doesnt really matter.
Dude, like, totally awesome prof! Helped in explaining abstract stuff in Physics 132.
Nice guy, Hard and challenging test, but fair either way.

I had him last quarter and he was great!  Always wanted made sure the class understood, and he obviously loves physics.  The class was alot of work, but fair.  Always helpful, especially if you ask.  (Plus he's hot!  another reason to go to office hours!)
worst class i've taken so far.  i used to like physics but now hate it.  grading of tests unfair, time for tests not nearly enough.
This guy is a stud.  But test and quizzes are hard as hell.
lectures very clear, and prof. is very helpful.  tests are hard but fair

his lecture is boring and most of them are NOT connected to the exam, you have 4 midterms and 1 final, 50% of the questions in the exam are come from test bank around 5000 questions, 1000 per module, and if you didn't do it before, you won't even know what the questions are asking about. you will struggle at the end of the semester. memorize all Qs

Dr. Vaessin is a great guy that cares about your success. However, he is not the greatest at teaching, nor is his class set up that well. I struggled big time in this class. Many of the below reviews sum his class up, go read them. Read the text and do the self evaluations (dozens of times). Work hard because this class was not easy.

As for his accent, it honestly didn't take away from the class. His long spiels are meant to interest us and connect class topics to real-life scenarios + there are MANY chances to succeed: test corrections, the final exam repeating questions, self-evaluations, one exam being dropped, etc, just come to class. Best professor for MOLGEN there is!!

Dr. Vaessin was very clear about what would be on exams. There were self evaluation modules for each exam so you could get familiar with questions. There was also an exam drop. He also offered bonus points for watching videos and there was pack back and mastering required. He sometimes went on tangents during lecture and had to leave early sometime

The class material itself is not necessarily difficult. It is pretty straightforward. Dr. Vaessin is a scientist by heart, but he is not meant to teach. Yes, he knows his stuff. However, the dude STRUGGLES to teach it in a way that makes sense. I often found myself just trying to find the point of why he was going on a 10-minute history tangent.

Graded aspects: Need 80% attendance. Weekly Packback posts. Packback is a company that scams students. Don't take classes that use Packback. Four exams. One will be dropped. These exams are the majority of your grade. Read the book because his lectures have NOTHING to do with the exam questions. 

You will struggle in this class, guaranteed.

There are 4 midterms and a final, with the lowest midterm dropped which will save you. He doesn't grade any homework until the very end so you never know your grade. Most of the lectures are off topic. Lots questions on exams come from the self evaluations he gives before so study those, but a majority will be stuff you have never heard in class.

I liked him! A majority of his lectures come straight from the book, so if you pay attention in class and read the book at home, this class shouldn't be particularly difficult. You do have to do a good amount of work, but Dr. Vaessin is fair. There is a test bank, but if you study the book and notes, you don't need to memorize every question

5 exams all semester, all the questions taken from a test bank, not from what he covers in lecture. Do his optional Carmen self assessments for practice questions, just like the exams. Online homework and learning curves not related to material on exams. This class is poorly structured & exams are tough. Dont take this class unless you HAVE to....

Very difficult to pay attention during lecture; he just isn't very captivating. His accent was a little tough for me to understand at time. My success in the course was to use the practice quizzes on carmen. Supporting staff were pretty terrible: vague in their answers or just plain wrong, uninterested, and inconsistent grading. Good luck!

As a bio major, I was already interested in this class to begin with which made studying for it less rough. At the end of the class he awards a few extra points and if he likes you he will bump you a letter grade if you were on the edge. Reading the book and going through power points is the best way of studying. Don't rely on his practice tests.

Vaessin started off teaching well, then ended up flying through the notes. The homework is a joke and memorizing the test bank is the only way to pass the exams. Make a Google doc for the final and get students to put their exam Q&A's in it because the final is HARD. Study early because the test bank for each exam is a PowerPoint of 500 slides.

Thank God this class curved! Test questions rarely come from lecture or book. You have to be able to read his mind! There are "module" exams every 3 or so weeks and they're worth most of your grade. He is not approachable or available outside of class. Online homework is mandatory and useless (must purchase access code). Uses TopHat for attendance.

Makes the class hard in all the wrong ways. Copies questions for his exams off of biol sc that are not in the book or the 300 pp slides he expects you to know by heart every 3 weeks. Most of the questions on the exams are too specific and are not covered sufficiently in his notes or the book which is another 150 pages to read every 3 weeks.

The class was very engaging  and he always asked questions which forced students to think through the experiments. He was very keen on knowing why we were performing certain steps, and if you took good notes, the final was a breeze.

Some days I'd learn a lot from him, other days I'd walk out of lecture not knowing what was going on. How to succeed:  get a question bank, take self-evaluations, study his lecture slides (because he likes to pull stuff from those too), read book about concepts you don't understand. Cannot stress the test bank though, it saved my MolGen life.

Nice guy, HORRIBLE lecturer. Tests Qs come out of a test bank (either get the bank from friends or take his self-evals 5+ times). The textbook, MasteringGenetics, and lectures will NOT help much with the tests. Also takes attendance via TopHat (need 80% attendance) which you have to purchase. Testing format is in class via Carmen quiz (hated this).

When I took 4501, it was the first time the course was offered, so practically no one knew how to teach it. But Dr. Vaessin made an effort to teach it the best he could. Besides the fact that we ran out of time and didn't complete portions of labs (especially the last lab), I felt that he was a good teacher. TAKE NOTES AND PAY ATTENTION THOUGH!!

great prof, he was obviously interested in the material, and explained topics clearly. only covered important topics during lecture, so reading the book is highly advised.  Not really a fan of the online testing system, but it worked fine (something like comp. breakdown was just ANOTHER thing to worry about during the exam)

I had Vaessin for Molgen. Although the testing system is not ideal, I thought he was very interested in teaching and it was evident that he really liked genetics.  Apart from the online testing, I really liked the class.

Vaessin was usually a pretty friendly guy. He's passionate about genetics and at least tries to do a good job teaching. The class itself is pretty horrible, though. The test bank they reuse year after year seems to stunt the creativity and dynamism of the class. Take practice tests over and over; get an A.

Harald is a nice guy if you make the effort to get to know him. Class is set up so that the professors can spend the majority of their time in their research labs. The tests are based on a question bank that are never discussed in lecture, but lecture is mandatory. Not necessary Harad's fault, but the class itself hurt my interest in genetics.

He is absolutely HORRIBLE. He doesn't teach, he just stands in front mumbling to himself and waving his laser pointer around. The only reason I passed this class is because their testing system is a joke. As far as retention... NONE. Learned nothing. Thank you Dr. Vaessin. I appreciate you wasting my money.

Terrible prof. Like the others said the class is essentially useless as the tests come from the book and questions off of online self evals about things never discussed in class. Impossible accent to decipher with his mumbling, and his cell phone went off at least once a week!

Oh Dr. Vaessin. I liked him as a person but teaching is not his strong point. He could be hilarious at times with how he said things but he's a tough professor. My suggestion is to reread the chapters and know the experiments well that he goes over. Get help from the learning center if you need it!!!

I learned absolutely nothing from him. Everything I learned was by spending time with the book. The tests aren't bad if you do the self-evals. Lectures are useless, but you gotta go because the clicker questions are ~10% of your grade.  Overall, the class was just really frustrating. Hurt my interest in genetics.

He is worthless.  Do the online self evaluations and read the book to teach yourself.  He is unreasonable and will not help students.  Do not take him!! The only reason I did was because there was no other prof teaching the class the quarter I needed it.

easy teacher, easy class. his accent is pretty bad, but i would by no means say he is a bad teacher like the previous reviews. I thought he was a really great teacher. He made it easy to understand, and had organized notes that he posted online.

For someone who pays $40,000 a year to attend school, the way Harald taught this class was like a slap in the face.  He was very vague on the fact that his lectures were useless and only those who read the book could do well.  I still did fine in the class, but the total frustration that resulted from taking him was easily not worth the A.
He was a hard teacher to understand, but if you do the self-evaluations and online tests you should do decent. Did pretty well in the class.

I can't even begin to describe how terrible this class is and how bad a professor he is.  Maybe the fact that out of 280 students only approx. 40 bother showing up to class should tell you how bad he is.  Can't understand him.  Just take self evaluation tests over and over to learn the material and read the book.

Many students don't give Dr. Vaessin a chance because he has a thick accent. However, it isn't all that difficult to get used to it, and in my estimation he does quite a good job of explaining things. Give him a chance and listen to him well, and you may learn quite a bit.

He is terrible, if you can even stay awake in his lectures, you'll find that his accent is horrible, no one can understand him, and it is pointless to attend his lectures... know the practice problem sets he gives out (use the TAs) and read the book, and you'll do well on his tests

Why would Ohio State hire someone so horrible? They could have saved their money on this guy. If you learn anything during his class it won't be from him it will be from the textbook and the textbook alone.

One of the worst foreign teachers that I have had so far. I couldn't sit through his lectures because of the way he spoke. The exams were not very difficult, but he wasn't very clear about what to study. Stay away from this professor.
He presents the material in an easy way and the exams are out of his lectures and book problems
I have had some foreign teachers in the past, but this guy has to be the worst. He is exremely hard to understand and is really boring.

I thought he was a very fair teacher.  He is kind of difficult to understand at times.  I had two teachers that taught this class and he was better than the other one. It was hard to adjust because they switched off and on.
No Comments
No Comments

For the first time teaching this class, I'd say she did a good job! I knew most of the information in the class since I took 1101 last semester, but she still taught it well. Weekly open-note quizzes and optional textbook. She also gave PLENTY of prep before midterm and final, both of which were also open-note.
Professor Ryden was hilarious and super knowledgeable! I only half paid attention, but her lectures were not dry! She keeps things interesting, and her cat is wonderful

Lectures dragged on, but she posted lecture slides beforehand so you had to take minimal notes during class. Textbook wasnt great, I eventually stopped reading and still did fine. Homework and midterms were for the most part straight forward from either class or the book.. occasionally a problem popped up that we did not know how to solve.

Professor Ryder is very knowledgeable and her Astronomy 1101 class is one of the best Ive ever taken. I learned more about math, science, and physics in this astronomy class then Ive learned in every other math and science class Ive ever taken combined. (Slight exaggeration) She does it all in a very understandable way too.

The professor is absolutely a nice person, but the lectures were just too heavy and boring sometimes. No homework for the lectures, so the three exams are almost everything. If you can spend much time on reviewing every slide for multiple times carefully before the exams, you would definitely get a much better grade than most people.
Very dry scientist type humor. Gives slides, but slides are missing some stuff seen during lecture. Exams taken directly from slides

Really intelligent professor but difficult GE course. Introduces chemistry, geology, and biology details that are hard to remember and the exams make up 90% of the grade with the only other 10% being weekly quizzes: none of which were dropped. Definitely have to work hard and pay attention to do well. Pretentious voice but nice person as well.

She is very intelligent and respected in her field. If you're taking her for a major class, that's fine. For a GE class, I wouldn't recommend though. She makes everything very technical, and wordy. the only grades are the exams, which sucks for poor test takers like me. The labs are very math-heavy, was not very interesting.

Prof Ryden is a good prof, but the set up of the course is BAD. The tests and quizzes are a lot harder than you'd expect for an intro course. Beware: You're expected to remember formulas, and VERY specific details. Midterms make up 50% of your grade, the final is worth 40% of your grade and the quizzes- 10%. Those are the only things she grades.

Professor Ryden seems like a very nice person outside of class but this was literally the most difficult course I have ever taken. The lectures are extremely confusing , her tests are EXTREMELY hard and feel virtually impossible to study for. It sucks the labs count for a slight percentage of your grade and the tests are worth a huge chunk.

Professor Ryden was a great lecturer! She was always very funny when you would least expect it and kept people engaged, which isn't always easy in a 120+ person lecture. You could tell she really cared about the material and she was always helpful in her office hours.

Professor Ryden is an awful professor. Very condescending towards students and just reads right off lecture slides. Most of the grade is based on exams which are hard. Labs are a ton of work for only 4 points. Wouldn't recommend this class to anyone. This is a basic GE class but they treat it like it's the most important class you'll ever take.

She's very condescending toward students because of how knowledgeable she is, but it is something you kinda get used to. She is very informative and her lectures provide a lot of necessary stuff, but you can view the lectures online. Overall, her class is easy to pass if you at least go over the notes once or twice. Her lectures are boring af

"Professor" Ryden is disrespectful and condescending toward students, TAs, and other professors. Her lectures are long and uninformative. This is the kind of material you learn in middle school. Step into the class and you'll instantly hear the pretension in her voice. I would not recommend this GE course to anyone.

It was an interesting, thought-provoking class, and professor Ryden was great. Exams really aren't that awful if you study the lecture slides thoroughly and read the book. 88% to get an A with the curve. Would highly recommend.

Subject matter is very interesting and I liked the material. However, if you are trying to get a good, easy grade -- avoid this class. Exams are ridiculous (3 AND a final) considering it's an intro class. A straight A/B student (me) struggled with her. Lectures are long and boring, but again, material is interesting, good grades are hard to get.

Very easy and interesting subject material, but the exams were very trivial.  I went to the majority of classes and studied and did poorly on the exams. She is very nice, but I felt like she was trying to trick us on exam questions.

Pretty good class. Many people skipped lectures, but they also didn't do so hot on exams. Don't need the book too much, most of the info she posts in pwrpnt slides. Only grades 3 midterms and a final, don't rely on a curve. If you study the powerpoint you'll do fine.
Great professor. Not a hard course, and you can learn something. Funny class time. And you don't need to buy the textbook, everything is in carmen. No mid-exam. Only 4 quizes and 1 final.
Sometimes she doesn't notice when people raise their hands to ask a question because she seems really into what she's saying. Gives funny examples and likes puns. Made for a fun class.

She really knows what she is talking about!! AST 143 is my fav GEC course so far. I was afraid that there would be hard core math and physics but it was much easier than I thought it would be. I was bad at all my science courses in high school so this is basically the first science course that I'm truly interested in and good at.

don't take this course. very tough and lot's of math. very little "actual astronomy". only 9 total grades, homework not in textbook, had to do work on a planet only discovered a mere 2 months ago. avoid at all costs, there are easier gec's
Don't take this class with this teacher. Not recommended.

Dont take this class, there are easier GECS unless you love Astronomy! This is NOT a history course, its more math. You will have MANY problem sets and in order to do well, you need to carefully read the book. Dont need to go to lectures, you'll doze off. Just read the notes she gives you (they are all online) Also communicate w/her during office h

This class is not what was described.  Lots of math and physics.  Her nazi TA graded the very hard homeworks like he was on a mission to fail you.  Way to subjective in the grading.  I would not recommend this class or professor to anyone that values fairness and competency as part of their education.

i thought it was the history of the universe as the class describes, but it is all math and physics and you do not get the equations on the exam....hard class but interesting stuff. she really has a passion for what he teaches that is one of the few positives.

This was a very hard class, mostly because of Ryden. DO NOT take her if at all possible. The hardest GEC I have ever taken.  The material is very cool, but she makes it boring.  Lecture isn't necessary, as she posts the slides online.  No review sessions or anything.  She was terrible!

A lot harder class than I expected.  All I can say is GO TO THE REVIEW SESSIONS!!!  She's pretty funny and loves teaching the info, although a lot of the time, the material is really boring.  Not the easiest GEC, but if you study hard, you'll do ok.  And you'll never forget about warthogs.

This class was pretty hard! I didn't do well on the first tests but after i went to the review sessions i did a lot better. she kinda falls over a lot..and she likes warthogs..kinda weird. GO TO THE REVIEW SESSIONS!

Although it seems like a blow-off class, believe me it is much more than planets.  Exams are tough and there are no other grade opportunities.  However, she is willing to sit down with students and explain things to them.  The second exam is probably the toughest so be prepared!

This is the hardest class that I have taken at OSU!  She is a very nice person and will help you out if you have any questions or concerns at all. The exams are REALLY hard and hurt my grade a lot though and unfortunately she doesn't offer extra credid any other points besides the exams.
She was a great teacher. She went the extra mile with bringing in demonstrations to help the class understand. Most interesting lecture I have had. Downfall is that her exams are very tough.
No Comments
No Comments
No Comments
No Comments
Very sweet professor and outlines material well. Class is easy and every lecture is recorded if you want to view later. An easy class that will blow your mind.
Extremely easy class, you don't have to attend lecture and she wasn't a very good lecturer anyway. Just use the PowerPoints for the quizzes and exams and you'll easily get an 100.
Easy GE. Exams and quizzes are straightforward if you have reviewed the slides. Attendance not mandatory, can watch lectures on your own time. Weekly quizzes and only 3 exams no final.

You will have to watch (or attend) all of the lectures and take meticulous notes or else you wont do well on the exams. The weekly quizzes can sometimes be tough, but the exams are pretty hard (however many of the exam questions mirror the questions asked in class). Every lecture is an overload of information as well.

Lecture slides are posted online, along with an optional weekly homework. She does a good job of explaining the concepts during lecture, which I recommend you attend. But attendence is optional and the material isn't too hard to learn on your own.

Smita is a pretty solid teacher. Boring class, and attendance isn't mandatory, but I would highly recommend going because she does make the concepts very clear. This class isn't the easiest A and a good bit of studying is needed for the exams, but as long as you really understand everything in the lecture slides you'll be fine. Take this class.

Smita tries her best to help you understand the material. Class was intellectually stimulating but required a lot of work especially if science isnt your strong suit. She posts the slides online but her lectures, review notes, and optional homework was extremely beneficial. Exams have a lot of homework qs and the final repeats a lot from old test.

The lectures are pretty long and boring if you are someone who is not interested in science, but I truly recommend going. She posts her lecture slides online, but she goes in depth during class to help you understand the concepts better. She posts homework online, but its not for a grade. The only grades are 3 exams and a final.

She posts study guides for her "History of the Universe Class". The study guide normally contains questions that are on the test. GO OVER THE STUDY GUIDE WELL. She post optional homework every week that also tend to end up on the exams. Attending lecture was not necessary because she posts the notes online, but she is extremely passionate about it.

She really loves the topic that she teaches and it shows. Seeing as she taught a science class for non science majors it would have been easy for her to blow it off but she really tried to make sure that everyone learned something. Class is easy but being there for her lectures is essential to understanding the material. DO NOT BUY THE TEXTBOOK

Had a great time in this class, at first I was worried because the material is based on extremely complicated concepts but Smita went above and beyond to get everyone (at least those to who pay attention) to understand what she was teaching. I genuinely enjoyed this class, even if it was just for a gen ed and will honestly recommend it to others

I loved her class; She was crystal clear for the most part and really cared about teaching us. I looked forward to coming to class everyday and while I didn't to AMAZING A++ in her class, I learned something and enjoyed it. I didn't think the class was hard at all and I never studied, if I did I'd have gotten that A. I'd definitely recommend it.

Helpful note: she tells you not to study off the review guide but I recommend going through it thoroughly and filling it out. this will help you organize your notes and prepare for the exam. also go over the homework q's (even if they're not graded)as I have noticed that she uses those on the exams.

good professor. She does try hard to help students understand the material and is successful at it. COME TO CLASS. even if you have a friend 2 take notes 4 you, you will understand them a lot better if you show up. Dont bother with the txtbook. you wont need it. theres a copy in the office if you happen 2 miss a class but its not helpful anyways.

GO TO CLASS!! Smita does not post her notes online and the book is useless. Make flash cards and study hard the day/night before exams and you will be golden! Use the internet to help you with your homework... it is 15% of your grade!

Very good teacher. I heard astronomy was a difficult class, but she makes it interesting & does not use any math in her teaching.Go to class to get the notes, do the homework, and study for the exams and you will do well; it really is not difficult! The final was straight up the 3 exams copy and pasted.

As long as you come to every lecture and do the simple homework assignments, this class is an easy A or B. You definitely do not need the book. She has an accent, but is still easy to understand. She also makes concepts extremely easy to grasp. I strongly recommended this professor.
She was hard to understand, and couldnt really understand student.  Exams were mildly difficult.  Go to class, it will help a lot.

I found she was very interesting in lectures.  I am interested in Astronomy already so that may have helped. Only study notes for tests.  I never opened my book one time, so dont buy it.  Lots of wrtiting but everything is on power point.

DO NOT SKIP CLASS! If you skip class you will be totally lost. She doesnt put the powerpoints online so if you miss class get the notes from someone! She has a very heavy accent and is hard to understand... if you can take this class with someone else, you should!
Teacher does a very good job explaining concepts and drilling important facts.  The subject is boring.  Use the book and go to lecture to get an A

semi-interesting class. she seems to want everyone to understand, and makes it a little easier by handing out homeworks. Tests aren't too bad, and she will work with you if your having difficulty. Her accent is annoying at times.

This class is pretty easy and requires little studying. She's an interesting teacher--makes really funny analogies which are made even funnier by her thick hindi accent. Sit in the front row and pay attention and it won't be too hard.
incredibly bad teacher

Boring, sometimes hard to understand class. Her accent doesn't help (where is she from anyways) - like everyone else here has said, don't buy the book and don't miss lecture (although if you do you can go to her office and copy the notes - sneak over to the copier in the room she takes you to!)
Got a B+, and did not work very hard.  She sucked as a lecturer and used tests from the test bank, which made her tests very different than the class or the book.

Very unsympayhetic, doesn't really seem to care if people learn or not.  Doesn't beleive in power point and yet gets annoyed if you take too long writing the notes down, god forbid.  Buying the book is also a waste of money, but don't skip any lectures if you can help it.
wow yeah if you skip lectures you will be taking this class again, dont buy the book.  At times very hard to understand, got a B.

whoa.  be prepared to be bored.  she doesn't believe in using power point, so be ready for some scrawly notes on an overhead sometimes.  Her accent is a bit thick but whatever.  you should get a class buddy so you dont have to go every day.  trust me.

Has no sympathy for anyone.  Has a hard time explaining herself due to heavy accent, and makes no effort to help condense the loads of facts put forth in her lectures.  Definitely don't skip the lecture, but don't buy the textbook either.
Hans was very passionate about the material being taught which made the class very interesting. He was a fair grader and allowed me to make up assignments I had missed. Overall very good professor.

His lecture materials are a little tough because he throws in a lot of unfamiliar vocab and he's kind of monotone in his lecture and mainly reads off the slides. But he's actually really nice and willing to explain any concept until you understand if you ask in office hours. He's also very accommodating and gave me a little boost in final grade

Dr Klompen taught module 2 on Malaria. Compared to the 1st module, this one was much more intense. His wording and expectation of knowledge for weekly quizzes is tough but if you prepare by reviewing everything you will be okay. His class is not easy but it is doable. Never miss recitation, those are the easiest points but a lot of group work.
Fantastic. The best teacher OSU has to offer. Very refreshing from the usual professors.

Pretty easy class overall if you half-pay attention. Quizzes every week are 2 questions, open note/open book (drop your 2 lowest quiz scores). A pretty big percentage of the grade is from completing weekly discussion board posts. He is obviously very passionate about parasites which translates into engaging and entertaining lectures.

Super unclear on grading and vague, rambles about things that won't be on the test. He reads off the slides which don't make any sense. Very harsh grader, looks for key words not concepts so right answers will be counted wrong if its not the answer he is looking for.

In class worksheets for every class, so you can't skip. Not very clear instructions for in class work. Recitation is all group work and completion. Final has an essay that had an average of 68% that was due earlier and final exam was all application and over nothing from powerpoints.
Clear, organized lecture slides and mostly reasonable questions on quizzes and midterm. In-class questions were confusing at times. Overall a decent professor.

Kind of funny. Pretty harsh with grading criteria. For the exam it seemed several answers could have been right. In lectures you need to bring a specific paper for short responses that are over something covered in class that day.  You lose points if you use a paper provided. Not unreasonable, but not great. This class makes me dislike biology.

He has pop quizzes on material covered that day in class which are confusing. Essays for exams are take home but he grades them harshly.  Exam questions are more difficult than anything covered in class. I would take the class with a different professor, if possible. However the bio department overall isn't the best so good luck
Outlines were useless, tests were difficult and he speaks in riddles
Dr. Klompen is a good professor, and likes to give random quizzes. If you read the book every once in a while and go to lecture you will be fine. He's pretty funny and likes biology.

It was fun to attend class because he was extremely funny and did well in keeping the students attention, but he is a hard grader, which is annoying. If you ask for feedback he gives it to you, which is always a plus.

I really enjoyed Dr. Klompen. He was genuinely interested in what he was teaching and really seemed to want to help students. His assignments were meaningful and not busy work, unlike assignments from previous professors in the other modules.

LOVED Dr. Klompen!  He's very personable and is genuinely interested in what he's teaching.  Taught the malaria module, which I found fascinating.  Best teacher out of this class.  Responded to emails very quickly and was very helpful.  Breath of fresh air after the cancer module.  Lenient grader, too!

He was an alright teacher. Not too great, not too bad. He taught the Malaria module which was pretty boring; it would be interesting if you had malaria or needed to study it for high research purposes. Was pretty clear, nice guy, exams were pretty fair, lot better than some of the other professors we had for this class for mixed modules.
Go to class. That's really all there is to it. Go to class and pay attention and you'll get an A in lecture. Just hope you don't get a idiot for lab like I did.

I like that he provides a lecture outline for you to print and jot notes on. Not really an amazing or terrible professor... takes a lot of information from the book, but for some reason grades how well you take notes in lecture. Only bad aspect was my foreign TA who didn't really... understand much/wasn't very helpful.

meh.  Not the worst ever but given the choice between him an an unknown, I'd take the unknown.  Many test questions tend to come from random tidbits from the book that may or may not have had an oblique mention in class, which you will be to asleep to hear anyway.  Only thing that saved me was that the lab grade is half the final grade.  Great ta's

Dr Klompen is a great lecturer.  He presents the material well and is always helpful to students.  Clearly some of these bad reviews are based on bad student performance.  He is straight with his students and does not use tricky questions in the exams.  I give him an A.

You can barely understand what he says during lectures. His lecture notes are outlines and he says his exams come straight from his outlines, but if you only study the outline, you'll fail the exams for sure! The outlines don't explain anything you need to know for the exams. He's terrible at explaining everything! Avoid this teacher!
Tests were random, lectures were sedating. My TA taught alot more and was waaaay better. Rock On, Josh Harris, Rock On!

I don't know how Hans got all these bad reviews.  I felt he was a really great prof and an interesting lecturer.  All you need to do is go to lecture and you will be fine.  An "A" is very possible, and you don't even need to read to get one.  Go Hans!

Horrible professor!!  Did not explain the material well at all.  His tests are very unfair.  He says that all you have to do is read the lecture notes and you'll do fine, however, the majority of the questions on the tests were from out of nowhere!!!  He doesn't follow the book either so that is no help.  Don't take his class if at all possible.

Def took class thinkin that as a bio major, if i put in a good amount of study time n went to every lecture would do ok.No matter how much studied w/ lect notes and book, received a flat 70 on every test.He just plain expects you to pick up EVERY detail.Basically impossible to get an A unless you memorize EVERYTHING you read and hear.
This professor may as well not even show up to his own lectures, he does not help his students and would probably rather spend all day with his precious mites.

DON'T TAKE THIS PROFESSOR.  Just don't.  You're asking for trouble.  The tests are based on lectures, so if you don't understand everything in lecture and go to your book for solace, you're in for a rough ride.  I also got the impression that he was there to do research, not teach.  Try to get another prof. if you want a decent grade.

I feel Hans is a very unfair teacher.  He made an introduction biology class very difficult.  I agree that it definately feels as though he does not care much about teaching and is here mainly for the research.  I really think it is fun for him to make this class difficult.  Try to avoid.

This guy plain and simple is a horrible prof. AVOID AT ALL COST. I liked bio before this class. On one of the midterms I answered a question correctly and answered everything the question asked for, but I still got it wrong because Klompen wanted people to explain more. How are we suppose to know that if the question doesnt ask it? VERY VERY BAD!!!

Bio 114 is an easy class.  But Dr. Klompen likes to make things harder on students.  How does he do this?  By basically not giving out answers to any of the practice or graded exams.  Great guy.*(sarcastic)*
This professor thinks that he enhances student understanding by creating obstacles to learning (he does not tell students what questions that they have missed on his tests).

I love Hans!  His tests are not terrible, but just a little tricky.  I really enjoy going to lec (even if it's early) because he's interesting and makes me laugh.  Plus, if you just go, you'll do fine on the tests.  His jokes are geeky, so if your somewhat geeky, he is funny.  Whatever, he's cool.

Maybe his teaching strats. have changed but for those of you who enjoyed him I'm suprised.  He gave me a strong vibe that hes not here to teach but just here for research.  His tests were horrible, and more so because I do not feel he prepares you even close to enough. Easy schedule take him, but if you have harder classes find another Bio Section.

He is very unfair with his exams. He says he only tests on the lecture notes. But so far both midterms have been about 1/3 stuff only in the book and or stuff he says only ONCE during lecture, thats not in the book. Hard to understand him. Seems like he enjoys making people suffer. DO NOT take his class if you can.
This guy loves biology! Kinda geeky, and his notes that are posted online don't cover EVERYTHING but that's so you go to class.   Sweet class.

I took his class a few quarters ago and really enjoyed it. I liked it so much I signed up to do personal research with him in entomology 693. I've continued this for 4 quarters. He's interesting in lecture and you hardly have to read the book.

I thought he was pretty good. His lectures were interesting (although I did see other people sleeping) and he is interested in the subject. He is European, if that makes any difference to you. I didn't think his tests were bad, and I found the TA's  to be helpful.
Very good professor, but if you take him, you absolutely HAVE to go to every lecture. His TAs are the worst I've ever had, and he gives quizzes in lecture that you aren't allowed to make up.

Klompen was awful. I'm a biology major, and he made biology boring for me by throwing out random facts in lecture and failing to go into the subject any deeper. He expressed little in-depth knowledge about biology beyond insects. Tests were unpredictable and straight memorization.

This class is not as bad as everyone says!  I am a SPANISH major and got a B, without reading all the material, half assing lab worksheets, and not going to any office hours or anything.  If you work a sufficient amount, you will get a good grade.  And there's a curve.

This is a TERRIBLE teacher. He's extremely unhelpful, won't ever answer emails, and doesn't care about students. He's lazy, and if you don't sit close, his voice sounds blurred. His tests are irrelevant to his vague notes. GET OUT NOW!!

His tests covered way too much information and you had no idea what to study. Attending lectures is a must because that is the only source of information for the tests. The labs are not interesting or graded fairly. There's too many things to complain about for this class.

He is an absolute terrible teacher. His tests are not an accurate reflection of material studied. I had to seek help from higher faculty memebers many times. Additionally, his TA choice is next to nothing, they are the worst at this university. DO NOT TAKE THIS CLASS with this man.
He is very thorough in lecture.

He is ok at lecturing, kinda crazy sometimes. But when it comes to the tests, he doesnt give a good idea on what to focus on. Tries to pick out little details on tests to trick you. Going to class is a must for additional notes, but sometimes boring.

This is one of the worst professors I've ever had.  No matter how much I studied for anything, I always found a way to screw up thanks to his inablity to create tests.  I would avoid him at all costs if it is possible.
Can keep my attention for the whole hour and 15 minutes.

For as much material as he has to cover he does a good job, going to lecture is a mus, he gives addtional notes. I studied so hard for the midterm, but it was just over so much! I got a D+...not a bad professor, he tries, and makes things clear and is fun.  It's Just a bad couse if general.

i studied my balls off for the midterm and i got a D because everything i studied was not on the test (he tested on freakin 14 chapters out of that monster bio book which equates to about 300 pages of information)... he lectures okay but his tests are poorly made - you have no idea what to expect
His tests are not fair.  I studied my ass off and knew about everything and his tests reflect nothing he lectured on.  Not a good teacher.  He thinks everything is "cute" and "pretty"
he is the worst teacher i have ever had, he is a  total lazy human, and his tests are not a reflection of his study, FIRE THIS PROF!!!
Notes are on WebCT, but additional notes in lecture always find their way onto exams, so it is necessary to attend lecture if you want an A.  This guy is good, he knows his stuff.
ZZZzzzz....  severely boring. Class is not all that hard but no curves.  His notes are on the web.  Don't bother going to class.
He's a cool guy, lecture's are NOT bad, too many people just sleep at this school at any chance. Bad part is what to study for exams, and his short answer questions tend to be a bit hard.
Good teacher but sooo much info with no help as to what to concentrate studies on
Very informative, nice guy!
Boring and hard
BORING!!! Lectures consist of reading the notes on Web CT.
Truly enthusiastic about the material! He provides amusing quotes for your profile!
All he talks about is termites.  Get the notes from a friend!
No need to go to Hans' lectures. All material on WebCT
Only take biology from him if you like long naps
Dr. Simcox is a very nice person. She tries to make her quizzes/tests as far as she can. There are no things that need to be purchased for this class which is helpful.

Dr. Simcox is as interesting as having the textbook read back to you in a British accent. You'll definitely learn, it'll be kinda fun at first, but pretty quickly you'll get bored. The exams are very straightforward and the questions can honestly be pretty entertaining. She can be boring, but it's clear that Dr. Simcox cares about her students.

Dr. Simcox is nice but her lectures were nearly worthless. She either repeated ideas from the book or talked on and on about her research with Drosophila flies. Unfortunately, TopHat scores are a large part of the grade so skipping class would be killer to your grade. Good intentions but uninteresting lectures. Tests were largely easy.
Mandy's module was on stem cells. She was an excellent lecturer. She was very fair and pretty much told us exactly what was going to be one each quiz and exam. I highly recommend her for this class.

Her lectures are near impossible to follow.  She's all over the place and I often find myself questioning whether she actually knows the material or not.  Read the book and the note hand outs she provides, and you'll be fine.  Lecture was next to worthless.
You will not get an A.  The kids in the class are by far among the smartest taking an honors bio class and around 90-95% of them didn't get an A.  Good luck if you take this class.

Simcox was more interested in talking about fruit flies and her research than what she was supposed to teach. Her midterm was MUCH harder than Ding's. You'll need to read to succeed. I appreciate that she knew the research side of bio, but it didn't help me on the midterms/final.

Seemed like she was more interested in talking about her own personal research and making little online presentations than actually teaching. Her test questions were ridiculously specific, and sometimes about material that wasn't even covered in the text. Lab was even more useless. Kind of makes me wish I'd taken the regular version.

I loved Dr. Simcox. She has a very interactive class and breaks up the standard lecture with videos and demonstrations. She also will discuss science in the news, which was cool because it showed how what we were learning could be applied to real issues. Her test was challenging, but fair. I wish she taught more of Bio 115H.

Dr. Simcox teaches H115 half and half with Dr. Ding. It's too bad, because she's intelligent, funny, and a gifted teacher, and he's not. Her midterm was extremely hard, with an average 20% lower than his, so be warned and study extra for hers! Her lectures are great, and reasonably interactive if you consider the massive class size.
her study guides are long and her tests are hard

She's a tough cookie but science is her career! I enjoyed her upper level classes immensely and her dedication to bringing high-level science into high schools is commendable.   PS: If you can't hack Bio113 you'd better not plan on taking anything more advanced!  Science takes work to wrap your head around all the concepts!  WORK!

I've never had her as a professor but I've spent one day with my entire AP Biology class with her doing two DNA labs. She was great! I loved the simulation, but it gets so difficult with the technical stuff. We ran out of time at the end, so she didn't have time to explain the math and what's involved, so my entire class was basically clueless. *_*

Okay, nobody told me she was British.  She is so much fun to listen to because of her accent.  I thought her exams weren't too bad, but you MUST read the book to supplement her lectures.  I would love to take another class with her.

Dr. Simcox was very interested in the "research" side of Biology more so than the "memorize all these enzymes" side of it.  The questions on her exams are very tricky, and if you plan to do well on the exams you should have a mastery of the classic experiments the textbook covers.  The examples she carried out in class came back up in the exams.

I could not follow her lectures and everything that came out of her mouth just wouldn't "click"--I understood the material much better by reading it in the book.  I would definitely not recommend her as a professor, and if you have no other choice, read the book thoroughly in order to grasp the material and do well on the exams.
She is a ton of fun in the Lab class because she's pretty laid back.  She usually makes a video and it's pretty amusing too, but her exams are hard.  Definitely Study, and get a good lab partner.
Tricky
She's tough but at least makes lectures mildly interesting.
No Comments
Her lectures weren't bad but the exam was really really hard and was on the most detailed stuff

Decent Teacher, the exam sucked because major error (read below). However, she does a pretty good job of lecturing fairly interesting even though some of the topics are not. Just hope they don't mess up your exams and it'll go ok.
Difficult exams. That's the most difficult one I ever had at OSU for low level courses.

She is extremely helpful and very nice, I really liked her.  She makes things seem easy and as if you don't need to know all the details, which is a little miss leading.  Did not have enough midterms for everyone the first time so the actual one was tough.  KNOW EVERYTHING INSIDE AND OUT!!

Worst professor by far at OSU.  Exam was insane.  It was nothing like the study guide.  She said know the study guide and you will get an A.  Definately not the case.  Also they did not have enough copies made for the second midterm.  Half the class short, unbelieveable.  She sucks!!!!

Stay away! Tricky exams! Our TA was totally inept,not to mention that the 2nd midterm exam was postponed because of their incompetence to assure that there were enough exams to go around; the retake was even more difficult because we "had more time to study for it", verified by the TAs. What BS.
Could not understand one word she said... I only went to 3 of her lectures because I couldnt sit in there any longer

although she has a british accent and sometimes sounds monotone, she really explains things using more than just notes. she makes hard topics seem easy. exam questions are usually straightforward. helpful study guides. great lecturer!
She's a very helpful prof, she always tried to help with study guides and sample problems.  I liked how she used interesting teaching methods to break up the monotony of lecture.
